climbs.name: The Truffle Shuffle
climbs.fa: Jim Barnes, Luke Potter, Rich Koehler 5/2018

content.description: Take the ramp up to the left facing corner and a roof protected with a fixed draw. A Truffle Shuffle will see you through the difficulties. Continue past one bolt to the shared anchor with Covfefe. 20m. Lower off.
content.protection: Gear: 4 bolts. Throw a .75 and a #1 Camalot on your harness too.
content.location: On the right side of the formation, there are several undercling flakes. The Truffle Shuffle ascends the leftmost roof.

content.description: Pickers and EB share the same start. For Pickers, clip the bolt then move up and left into the crack. Pass one more bolt on your way up to the shared anchors with E.B. This is an old school bold lead. 20m. Lower off.
content.protection: Gear: Micro to #1 Camalot. Two bolts.
content.location: Right side on the main face.

content.description: This route starts on the left side of the main face, just left of Davey Rock 2.0. Start up cracks, then move right onto the blunt arete protected by two bolts. Lower off the anchors shared with Davey Rock 2.0.
content.protection: Gear: A small selection of pieces up to #1 Camalot. Two bolts.
content.location: Left side of the main face.

content.description: Climb the crack on the right side of the main face. 20m. Move up and left to the shared anchor with Pickers. Lower off.
content.location: Right side of the main face.

climbs.name: Davey Rock 2.0
climbs.fa: 1.0? Unknown. FA 2.0 Jim Barnes, Luke Potter, Rich Koehler 5/2018

content.description:
This route starts a few feet right of Exit Stage Right. It is unclear if this route was climbed before. The first edition of the Lewis/ Moynier guidebook mentioned the route Davey Rock, and has a line drawn on a photo approximately where this route is located. However, the description didn't quite match and there was no evidence of the bolt called out in the guidebook's description. Davey Rock 2.0 now has a new bolt.

Climb up flakes to the bolt, then continue up and right into the crack that leads to the shared anchor with Exit Stage Right. Lower off.

Note: There are fun top rope options on either side of Davey Rock 2.0.
content.location: This route is just left of center on the main face.

content.description: This route is a few meters right of The Truffle Shuffle. Â Undercling into the left facing corner. Pass one bolt and continue up easy terrain up to the anchors. 20m. Lower off.
content.protection: Gear: Singles to .75 Camalot. One bolt.
content.location: On the right side of the formation, there are several undercling flakes. Covfefe ascends the rightmost flake.
